gurmukhi: ਦਾਨ ਅਾਨਿ ਪੂਜਯੋ ਤਬੈ ਗਯਾਨ ਬਾਨ ਲੈ ਹਾਥ || ਜ੍ਵਾਨਿ ਜਾਨਿ ਮਾਰਯੋ ਤਿਸੈ ਧਯਾਨ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਕੇ ਸਾਥ ||੮੪||੩੧੧||
transliteration: Daan Aan(i) Poojyo Tabai Gyaan Baan Lai Haath|| Jvaan(i) Jaan(i) Mdaryo Tisai Dhyaan Mantra Ke Saath||84||311||
translation: Then the warrior name Daan, taking the arrows of Gyan in his hand, performed worship and gave offerings, charming it with Dhyan, he discharged it on that Youngman.84.311.

gurmukhi: ਰਣੰ ੳੁਛਲਯੋ ਦਾਨ ਜੋਧਾ ਮਹਾਨੰ || ਸਭੈ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਲੌ ਬਸਤ੍ਰ ਨਿਧਾਨੰ ||
transliteration: Ranan Ouchadyo Daan Jodhaa Mahaanan|| Sabhai Shastra Au Bastra Astran Nidhaanan||
translation: The warriors named Daan sprang up in the war-arena, who was the store of arms, weapons and garments;

gurmukhi: ਦਸੰ ਬਾਣ ਸੋ ਲੋਭ ਕੋ ਬੱਛ ਮਾਰਯੋ || ਸਰੰ ਸਪਤ ਸੌ ਕ੍ਰੋਪ ਕੋ ਦੇਹੁ ਤਾਰਯੋ ||੮੫||੩੧੨||
transliteration: Dasan Baad So Lobh Ko Bachchh Mdaryo|| Saran Sapat Sau Krodh Ko Deh(u) Tdaryo||85||312||
translation: Taking ten arrows, he discharged them on the waist-area of Lobh; he seemed to be swimming in the seven oceans of Krodha.85.312.

gurmukhi: ਨਵੰ ਬਾਣ ਬੇਧਯੋ ਅਨੰਨਯਾਸ ਬੀਰੰ ਤ੍ਰਯੋ ਤੀਰ ਭੇਦਯੋ ਅਨਾਬਰਤ ਧੀਰੰ ||
transliteration: Navan Baan Bedhyo Anannyaas Bderan|| Trayo Teer Bhedyo Anaabarat Dhderan||
translation: With nine arrows, he pierced the warrior named Anyaaya (injustice) and the warriors named Avarai was pierced with three arrows;

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਭੇਦਿ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੰ ਸਤੰ ਸੰਗਿ ਮਾਰੇ || ਭੲੀ ਧੀਰ ਧਰਮੰ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਤਾਰੇ ||੮੬||੩੧੩||
transliteration: Bhayo Bhed(i) Krodhan Satan San(i) Mdare|| Bhaidheer Dharman Brahm Giaan Tdare||86||313||
translation: With seven arrows, he wounded the warrior named karodh (anger); in this way Brahm-Gyan (Knowledge of God or Dharma) was patiently established.86.313.

gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਬਾਣ ਕੁਲਹਤ੍ਰ ਤਾਕੋ ਚਲਾੲੇ || ਕੲੀ ਬਾਣ ਲੈ ਬੈਰ ਕੇ ਬੀਰ ਘਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Kai Baan Kulhatra Taako Chadhaae|| Kaibaan Lai Bair Ke Beer Ghaae||
translation: Several arrows discharged at Kalah, making him the target and with many arrows the warriors of Vair (enmity) were killed;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਅਾਲਸ ਕੈ ਅੰਗ ਲਾਗੇ || ਸਭੈ ਨਰਕ ਤੇ ਅਾਦਿ ਲੈ ਬੀਰ ਭਾਗੇ ||੮੭||੩੧੪||
transliteration: Kite Ghaae Aalas Kai An Laage|| Sabhai Narak Te Aadh Lai Beer Bhaage||87||314||
translation: Many arrows struck the limbs of Aalas (laziness) and all these warriors fled towards hell.87.314.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੈ ਬਾਣ ਨਿਸੀਲ ਕੌ ਅੰਗ ਛੇਦਯੋ || ਦੁਤੀ ਕੁਸੱਤਤਾ ਕੋ ਭਲੈ ਸੂਤ ਭੇਦਯੋ ||
transliteration: Ikai Baan Niseel Kau An Chedyo|| Doutikousattltaa Ko Bhalai Soot Bhedyo||
translation: With one arrow the limb of Asheel was pierced and the second arrow was very nicely inflicted Kutisata;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਮਾਨਾਦਿ ਕੇ ਚਾਰ ਬਾਜੀ ਸੰਘਾਰੇ || ਅਨਰਥਾਦਿ ਕੇ ਬੀਰ ਬਾਂਕੇ ਨਿਵਾਰੇ ||੮੮||੩੧੫||
transliteration: Goumaanaadh Ke Chaar Baajisanhdare|| Anarthaadh Ke Beer Baanke Nivdare||88||315||
translation: The comely horses of Abhiman (ego) were killed and also destroyed the fighters of ANARTH etc.88.315.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਪਾਸਾ ਛੁਧਾ ਅਾਲਸਾਦੀ ਪਰਾਨੇ || ਭਜਯੋ ਲੋਭ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੀ ਹਠੀ ਦੇਵ ਜਾਨੇ ||
transliteration: Pipasaa Chhudhaa Aalsaadiparaane|| Bhajyo Lobh Krodhihathidev Jaane||
translation: Pipasa (thirst), Kshudha (hunger), Aalas (laziness) etc. ran away and knowing the enragement of Daviva (divinity), Lobh (greed) also ran away;

gurmukhi: ਤਪਯੋ ਨੇਮ ਨਾਮਾ ਅਨੇਮੰ ਪ੍ਰਣਾਸੀ || ਧਰੇ ਜੋਗ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਅਲੋਭੀ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ ||੮੯||੩੧੬||
transliteration: Tapyo Men Naamaa Aneman Pranaasee|| Ddare Jog Astran Alobhiudaasee||89||316||
translation: The destroyer of Aniyam (indiscipline), Niyam (principle) also became enraged and that detached one without greed assumed Yogastras (the arms of Yoga).89.316.

gurmukhi: ਹਤਯੋ ਕਾਪਟੰ ਖਾਪਟੰ ਸੋ ਕਪਾਲੰ || ਹਨਯੋ ਰੋਹ ਮੋਹੰ ਸਕਾਮੰ ਕਰਾਲੰ ||
transliteration: Hatyo Kaaptan Khaaptan So Kapaalan|| Hanyo Roh Mohan Sakaamannd Karaalan||
translation: The head of Kapat (deception) was broken and he was killed and the dreadful warriors like Rosh (anger), Moha (attachments), Kaam (lust) etc. were also killed in great fury,
